an2.151:1.1: “There are these two kinds of welcome.
an2.151:1.3: Welcome in things of the flesh and welcome in the teaching.
an2.151:1.4: These are the two kinds of welcome.
an2.151:1.5: The better of these two kinds of welcome is the welcome in the teaching.”
an2.152:1.1: “There are these two kinds of hospitality.
an2.152:1.3: Hospitality in things of the flesh and hospitality in the teaching.
an2.152:1.4: These are the two kinds of hospitality.
an2.152:1.5: The better of these two kinds of hospitality is hospitality in the teaching.”
an2.153:1.3: The quest for things of the flesh and the quest for the teaching.
an2.153:1.5: The better of these two quests is the quest for the teaching.”
an2.154:1.3: The search for things of the flesh and the search for the teaching.
an2.154:1.5: The better of these two searches is the search for the teaching.”
an2.155:1.1: “There are these two kinds of seeking.
an2.155:1.3: Seeking for things of the flesh and seeking for the teaching.
an2.155:1.4: These are the two kinds of seeking.
an2.155:1.5: The better of these two kinds of seeking is seeking for the teaching.”
an2.156:1.1: “There are these two kinds of worship.
an2.156:1.3: Worship of things of the flesh and worship of the teaching.
an2.156:1.4: These are the two kinds of worship.
an2.156:1.5: The better of these two kinds of worship is worship of the teaching.”
an2.157:1.1: “There are these two ways of serving guests.
an2.157:1.3: Serving guests with things of the flesh and serving guests with the teaching.
an2.157:1.4: These are the two ways of serving guests.
an2.157:1.5: The better of these two ways of serving guests is to serve them with the teaching.”
an2.158:1.3: Success in things of the flesh and success in the teaching.
an2.158:1.5: The better of these two successes is success in the teaching.”
an2.159:1.1: “There are, mendicants, these two kinds of growth.
an2.159:1.3: Growth in things of the flesh and growth in the teaching.
an2.159:1.4: These are the two kinds of growth.
an2.159:1.5: The better of these two kinds of growth is growth in the teaching.”
an2.160:1.3: The treasure of things of the flesh and the treasure of the teaching.
an2.160:1.5: The better of these two treasures is the treasure of the teaching.”
an2.161:1.1: “There are these two kinds of accumulation.
an2.161:1.3: Accumulation of things of the flesh and accumulation of the teaching.
an2.161:1.4: These are the two kinds of accumulation.
an2.161:1.5: The better of these two kinds of accumulation is the accumulation of the teaching.”
an2.162:1.1: “There are, mendicants, these two kinds of increase.
an2.162:1.3: Increase in things of the flesh and increase in the teaching.
an2.162:1.4: These are the two kinds of increase.
an2.162:1.5: The better of these two kinds of increase is increase in the teaching.”
